column4: Does anybody know why a portable drive would appear, mount, then a minute after i start it copying a few files to the desktop it disappears/unmounts on its own and gives an error? I'm using Parallels on OS X.
look at dmesg or /var/log/syslog, to see if you can get more info in the error
personally i can't make any sense of the output from dmesg, but i can depaste the last dozen lines or so and maybe you'll know what it means?
http://pastebin.com/3QFhsjm0 this time it quit before i even started copying any files, just spontaneously
i'm looking into it. this is a WD external hard driver?
yes sir, i thought it was FAT formatted but i suspect it maybe Ext2 or 3 based on os x's disk utility info
you have external power source  connected?
it runs off the usb's power
well, does it alsow allow you to plug it in with an extra adapter?
well, there aren't any other places to plug anything into it

ok. that particular usb port being unable to power device while it's running  "might" explain it. does it do the same if you plug it into the back (or front, whatever is opposite to what you have) i'll check other possiblities....
it's a macbook so there are only two usb plugs on the side. Maybe there's a usb device powered by the wall socket that also has usb connections on it that i could connect this drive to?
i doubt this is the problem, but it couldn't hurt to try. i'm still looking at other stuf....
can you give me the exact model number of your external HDD?
